paper_metadata.title: Uneven burden of cardiac amyloidosis in people of African descent — global imbalance in resources and access
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V142I, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Even given a conservatively estimated low penetrance of 10–20%, it means that there may be 160,000 to 320,000 Black Americans at risk of early heart failure who are relatively underdiagnosed.

functional_data.summary: The V142I variant is associated with a higher incidence of heart failure and heart failure hospitalizations.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: allele frequency 0.02 in self-identified Black Americans; 0.0253 in West African populations.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is almost exclusively found in people of African descent.
key_quotes: Cohort studies in the USA have shown that 3–4% of self-identified Black Americans carry this gene variant.
The most common mutation results from a G to A transition at a CG dinucleotide in codon 142.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene variant V142I.
